籤詩版本二:
Running around and blocking many dangers
Carrying water and dragging Ni to climb mountains
I even look to other places for help.
Traveling thousands of miles away and never returning
詩意: This hexagram is like dragging mud and water. It's good to be conservative in everything.
解曰: Retreat is possible. Progress is difficult. Just be conservative. Don't expect to climb high.
籤詩故事一:
◇It is difficult for Qiuniang to leave
Du Qiu was a native of Jinling in the Tang Dynasty.
At the age of 15, she became the concubine of Li Qi (a traitor in the Tang Dynasty).
In the second year of Yuanhe (807), Li Qi officially launched an army to rebel. Later, Li Qi's rebellion failed and Du Qiu was included in the palace. Later, she was favored by Emperor Xianzong of Tang Dynasty and became a concubine.
In the fifteenth year of Yuanhe (820), Tang Muzong came to the throne and appointed her as his son Li Min's Fumu (a nanny who specialized in taking care of the children of the royal family).
Later, Li Min was deposed as King of Zhang, and Du Qiuci returned to his hometown.
When Du Mu passed by Jinling, he saw her poor and old...
(This story is a metaphor for the regret that things get worse every time.)
聖意:
Home and house are unfavorable.
Pray for yourself.
Seeking wealth: Autumn and winter are auspicious.
The transaction was mediocre.
Marriage prayer.
Liujia: Pray for blessings.
Pedestrians block.
Field silkworms are unfavorable.


Six animals are unfavorable.
Finding people is difficult.
Litigation loss.
Migration is lucky.
Lost property is missing.
Disease brings blessing.
Mountain graves are unfavorable.
